snippet: Maria Semple, the author of “Where’d You Go, Bernadette,” a sendup of privileged Seattle, tells what she really thinks of that city.
abstract: Television writer Maria Semple, after moving to Seattle from Los Angeles, wrote the novel Where'd You Go, Bernadette to express her dislike for her adopted city and to encourage its residents to laugh at themselves.
lead_paragraph: Maria Semple, the author of “Where’d You Go, Bernadette,” a sendup of privileged Seattle, tells what she really thinks of that city.

headline.seo: Maria Semple, Author of ‘Where’d You Go, Bernadette’
headline.main: A Novel Asks Seattle to Laugh at Itself
headline.print_headline: A Novel Asks Seattle to Laugh at Itself
